choices.name: Learn about basic Native American research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Get an introduction to Native American research in these articles.

    ☆ TH—Tracing Indian Ancestry - 2019
    ☆ FS—Overview of American Indian Research—6 pgs. - 2015

  2. Here is an overview for beginning your Native American / First Nations research.

    ☆ APL—Native American/First Nations Research—83:41 - 2018

  3. Get an overview of Native American family history on the Archives.com site.

    ☆ AR—Native American Family History

  4. Watch this video to learn the basics of Native American research.

    ☆ BYU—Native American Research—14:39 - 2016



  5. Learn more about researching Native American ancestors in this video.

    ☆ AA—Researching Native American Ancestors at NEHGS—60:31 - 2016



  6. U.S. Dept. of Interior: Learn about Native American research in this article from the U.S. Dept. of the Interior.

    ☆ Genealogical Research

Tips and Strategies
  1. Read about tips for exploring Native American ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Researching Your American Indian Ancestors—8 pgs. - 2016
    ☆ AC—Searching for Native American Ancestry? - 2015

  2. Watch this video for additional steps in Native American research.

    ☆ AAC—Native American Ancestry: Steps to Learn More—Video Series (account required)

  3. Here are additional tips and resources for Native American research.

    ☆ PR—Native American Ancestry: Tips and Resources, Part 1
    ☆ PR—Native American Ancestry: Tips and Resources, Part 2

  4. This article discusses helpful strategies for Native American / First Nations research.

    ☆ RT—Native, First Nations, Indian: Researching Indigenous Peoples - 2019

choices.name: Learn more about Native American research.

content.text:
1. Resources & Records: Explore resources for Native American research on the AccessGenealogy.com site.
  2. Explore ☆online records and databases for Native American research on the Genealogy Branches site.
  3. Books: Explore the ☆Books We Own site for books that can be checked out or researched for you by others.
  4. Message Boards: Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Native American research.
  5. See also the American Indian links listed in Goal 12 of each U.S. state page in The Family History Guide .

choices.name: Solidify proof for your Native American ancestry.

content.text:
1. Watch this video to learn more about proving family lines traced to Native Americans.

    ☆ AC—Proving Your Native American Ancestry—22:44 - 2011



  2. This article from the Bureau of Indian Affairs provides guidelines for tracing American Indian and Alaska Native ancestry.

    ☆ A Guide to Tracing American Indian & Alaska Native Ancestry

  3. Read these articles for tips on verifying Native American ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Joining Your Family's Native American Tribe - 2016
    ☆ AC—Identifying Direct Sources to Prove Native American Ancestry - 2016

  4. DNA: Learn about DNA testing for Native Americans.

    ☆ GE—Native American DNA Testing - 2022

  5. Learn more about DNA testing for Native American ancestry.

    ☆ RT—Using DNA Testing to Uncover Native Ancestry—21:09 - 2022

name: Special Topics
section_name: Explore special topics with Native American ancestry research.

choices.name: Learn about a variety of Native American research topics.

content.text:
1. Learn about avoiding pitfalls in Native American research.

    ☆ Avoid the Pitfalls in Native American research—15:00 - 2011



  2. Naming Conventions: Learn about naming conventions to use in Native American research.

    ☆ Native American Names Guidance

  3. New England: Learn about researching Native Americans in New England.

    ☆ AA: Native Nations of New England

  4. CCC: Learn about the CCC (Civilian Conservation Corps) Indian Division.

    ☆ AG—The CCC Indian Division - 2016

  5. Baker Rolls: Learn about using the Baker Rolls in your research.

    ☆ RT—Using the Baker Roll for Native American Research—10:59 - 2022



Tribes and Ethnicity
  1. Learn about doing research in the five largest Native American tribes.

    ☆ RT—The Big Five: Researching the Five Largest Tribes, Part 1 of 3—20:35 - 2021


    ☆ RT—The Big Five: Researching the Five Largest Tribes, Part 2 of 3—24:18 - 2021


  2. Cherokee: Watch the video or read the article to learn more about researching lines tied to the Cherokee tribe.

    ☆ FS—Cherokee Genealogy—60:00 - 2010
    ☆ FS—Cherokee Research

  3. Learn about tracing Cherokee ancestry in this article.

    ☆ LT—Researching Cherokee Ancestry

  4. African American: Learn about persons of mixed African-American and Native American ancestry, in Indian territory, on the African-Native American Genealogy site.

The Dawes Rolls are a collection of names of those who were given allotments when the reservations were disbanded.

  1. Get an introduction to the Dawes Rolls.

    ☆ AG: The Dawes Rolls
    ☆ How To Use The Dawes Roll

  2. Watch this video to learn how to use the Dawes Rolls in Native American research.

    ☆ AC—Using the Dawes Rolls—23:00 - 2012



  3. Learn how to locate ancestors in the Dawes Rolls.

    ☆ FS: Locating Ancestors on the Final Rolls of the Five Civilized Tribes—25:57 - 2011

choices.name: Access the Bureau of Indian Affairs Census.

content.text:
1. Read this article to learn about using census records from the BIA.

    ☆ AG—Indian Census Rolls

  2. Learn about BIA Industrial Surveys of the 1920s.

    ☆ AG—The Bureau of Indian Affairs Industrial Surveys of the 1920s

name: Search Records
section_name: Search records for your Native American ancestors.

content.text:
1. Census: Learn about Native Americans in the U.S. census from 1860-1890.

    ☆ AG: Native Americans in the Census, 1860-1890 - 2006

  2. Learn about the U.S. Indian Census Schedules.

    ☆ Censuses of American Indians

  3. Learn about Native American censuses.

    ☆ AC: Native American Censuses

  4. Military: Learn about Native Americans in the Antebellum U.S. military.

    ☆ AG—Native Americans in the Antebellum U.S. Military - 2007

  5. Misc.: Explore Native American record resources on the ☆Olive Tree Genealogy site.

QUIKLinks

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Native American research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the ☆Native American Genealogy page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the ☆Native American Genealogy—Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the ☆Native American Indian Genealogy page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with Native American research.
  5. Explore Native American research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.
